intro: Pseudognaphalium melanosphaeroides, commonly known as black sphere everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Pseudognaphalium melanosphaeroides is valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in challenging conditions.
